componentPropertyDescriptors.propertyInfo: The REST method to be used to make the request. Possible values are: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS.

objectProperties.propertyInfo: Sets the remote host the HTTP request will be sent to.
Sets the remote port the HTTP request will be sent to.
Sets the base request path for all listeners using this configuration.
The http protocol to be used in the request. Possible values are: HTTPHTTPS.
Returns the timeout in milliseconds used when requesting a connection from the connection manager. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
Determines the timeout in milliseconds until a connection is established.
Defines the socket timeout in milliseconds, which is the timeout for waiting for data or, put differently, a maximum period inactivity between two consecutive data packets.
Max connections to be kept in the connection pool for all the requests to the given host.
If true keeps the TCP connection open for multiple HTTP requests/responses.
If true, HTTP responses with redirects codes 3xx (301, 308) are automatically followed.
If true, sends Expect: 100-continue header in the initial request before sending the body.
If true, all requests to a host with a self signed certificate are not verified.
Specifies the type of authentication to be performed on the remote server. Possible values are: NONE, BASIC, DIGEST.
The username to be used in the remote server basic authentication.
The password to be used in the remote server basic authentication.
Immediately sends basic authentication header before the server answers with unauthorized response code.
The username to be used in the remote server digest authentication.
The password to be used in the remote server digest authentication.
Immediately sends digest authentication header before the server answers with unauthorized response code.
Realm value to be used in the digest authentication.
Nonce value to be used in the digest authentication if known.
Enables or disable the use of proxy. Possible values are: NONE, PROXY.
The proxy host name.
The proxy port.
The proxy authentication scheme to use. Possible values are: NONE, BASIC, DIGEST.
The username to be used in the basic proxy authentication.
The password to be used in the basic proxy authentication.
The username to be used in the digest proxy authentication.
The password to be used in the digest proxy authentication.

componentPropertyDescriptors.propertyInfo: The base URL of the HTTP request. It may include a static request path.
The request path might contain parameters placeholders which will be bound to the values defined in the Headers and parameters > Path params map.
Sets the payload of the HTTP request. It could be a dynamic or a static value.

Determines the strategy type the body will be sent to the server. When Stream the request body will be sent chunk by chunk without loading the entire content into memory. When None the body will be loaded into memory and then sent to the server. When Auto the component will inspect the content of the body to determine the best strategy to send the HTTP request data.
Map of dynamic headers names > values. The values are dynamic.
Map of request path parameters names > values. The values are dynamic.
Map of request query parameters names > values. The values are dynamic.

objectProperties.propertyInfo: The buffer size to be used while receiving the HTTP response.
The buffer size to be used while sending the HTTP request.
The host this REST listener will be bound to.
The port this REST listener will be bound to.
The http protocol to use. Possible values are: HTTP, HTTPS.
The base path shared by all the listeners using this configuration.
Enables socket keep alive for this listener.
If true the response is compressed before sending it to the client.
Sets the socket read timeout for this listener in milliseconds.
Sets the socket connection timeout for this listener in milliseconds.
The number of pending connections the listener queue will hold.
The maximum length of the content of each chunk.
The maximum length of all headers.
Specifies the server security type. Possible values are: CERTIFICATE_AND_PRIVATE_KEY, KEY_STORE.
The path on the filesystem to the certificate file.
The path on the filesystem to the private key.
The path on the filesystem of the key store.
The keystore password.
The keystore type.
The keystore algorithm.
If true the given trust store is used.
The path on the filesystem of the trust store.
The trust store password.
The trust store type.
The trust store algorithm.

componentPropertyDescriptors.propertyInfo: The rest path this listener will be bound to. If present must start with '/'. The path might contain regexp, e.g: /{name:.*} which would match against anything it is compared to, or parameters /{group}/{id}. Path parameters are bound to a key/value map in the inbound message attributes.
The REST Method this listener will be listening from.

Determines the way the response body is sent to the client. When set to Auto and if the size of the payload is not clear, e.g. it is a stream of data, then it uses Transfer-Encoding: chunked when sending data back to the client. Otherwise Content-Length encoding with the size of the payload is used. When set to Always Transfer-Encoding: chunked is always used, and when none Content-Length is always used instead.

objectProperties.propertyInfo: The body of the response might be a static or a dynamic value.
The status code of the response might be a static or a dynamic value, e.g. could be a variable defined in the flow context: context.myResponseStatus.
The body of the error response might be a static or a dynamic value.
The status code of the error response might be a static or a dynamic value, e.g. could be a variable defined in the flow context: context.myErrorResponseStatus.
